name: Ratmen Clans
background:
Ratmen Clans are humanoid rats, originally created as an accidental byproduct of advanced genetic science. Lacking the organization and skill of other factions, Ratmen clans use their vast numbers and a variety of weapons to defeat their foes. 

As Ratmen emerged to their creators as sentient beings, they were greeted with fear and violence, and they were forced into a life of hiding and scavenging until they could flee their home world. Now that they finally found safety on secluded and abandoned worlds, where their numbers rapidly grew, they seek to help others even as many in Sirius still view them as vermin.
backgroundFull:
Soon after their arrival in Sirius, the Conduitâ€™s followers turned to genetic experimentation to adapt to the challenges of their new reality. Their scientists began testing on the rodents who had stowed away in their fleet, but they had to make due with their rather limited number of test subjects, reusing them multiple times over a number of tests.

These test subjects began to grow, developing increased reaction time and strength compared to typical rats. Some scientists began to report signs of collaboration, tool use, and even communication among the rodents. Rumours began to spread about subjects escaping the laboratories. These reports were ignored and dismissed by superiors who were desperate for further advances to be made to the Battle Brother gene-mods.

Feral colonies of rats began to form outside of the labs, where the descendants of the original test subjects continued to grow in size and intelligence. The resulting species had become fully sapient and gradually emerged to greet their creators as equals. The humans who created them, however, viewed them with horror and revulsion, and the Ratmen were driven into hiding as Humanity hunted them as vermin and failed test subjects.

The Ratmen soon decided to flee off world rather than risk destruction if they were discovered. They began to raid less defended ships and scrap heaps in order to slowly assemble a fleet. Yet before they left, the Ratmen agreed that they could not escape and leave the other rats to their fate. Together, the Ratmen launched a raid on the laboratories where they were created, and despite heavy casualties, they escaped with the surviving test subjects.

The fleeing Ratmen fleet found a remote and uninhabited system, where they could build a new home for themselves. Some decided to stay there and remain hidden from the Battle Brothers and those like them. Others decided that they no longer wished to hide from the galaxy. Instead, these Ratmen formed into family-run clans on their ships and began to explore the stars.

As the Ratman clans encountered other factions, they began to recognize their own former plight in those oppressed or imprisoned by other factions. The Clans use their skills to help others escape, or otherwise sabotage those they view as oppressors, and some factions have come to view them as foes and vermin, to be actively sought out for destruction.

How will you survive in a sector that views you as vermin?

spells.name: Weapon Booster
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Scurry Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Focused Shock
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Shred.

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Power Surge
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy models within 12", which take 2 hits with Hazardous each. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 1" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Hazardous
specialRules.description: Gets AP(4), but this model's unit takes one wound on unmodified rolls of 1 to hit.

specialRules.name: Quick Readjustment
specialRules.description: This model ignores penalties from shooting after moving when using Indirect weapons.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Precision Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ambush. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Piercing Assault. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Evasive Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Evasive. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Scurry
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Ravage
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one wound.

specialRules.name: Defense Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which gets -1 to defense rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Evasion. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Self-Destruct
specialRules.description: If this model is killed in melee, the attacking unit takes X hits. If this model survives melee, after both sides have finished attacking, it is immediately killed, and the enemy unit takes X hits.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Scurry Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Scurry Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Reinforcement
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule is shaken or fully destroyed, you may remove it from the table as destroyed and place a new copy of it fully within 12" of any table edge at the beginning of the next round after Ambushers have been deployed. Units that deploy via Reinforcement canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy, and this rule doesnâ€™t apply to the new copy of the unit.

specialRules.name: No Retreat
specialRules.description: Whenever a unit where most models have this rule fails a morale test that causes it to be Shaken or Routed, the test counts as passed instead. Then, roll as many dice as the number of wounds it would take to check for wound effects (must always roll at least 1 die), and for each result of 1-3 the unit takes one wound, which can't be ignored.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds donâ€™t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9â€ away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Evasive
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Scurry Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Scurry, it moves +4" on Advance and +4" on Rush/Charge from Scurry (instead of only +2" and +2").

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.
